results.title: Spirit of the railway
results.brief_description: This moving documentary provides a personal journey through one of the most significant events in Australia’s history; the construction of the Thai-Burma railway. The railway was built by Australian prisoners of war and other allied and Asian laboueres during World War 2. The video uses personal accounts, forensic and historical footage, most of which hasn’t been seen in America, Australia or Japan. Features artwork by Ronald Searle, Jack Chalker, Ray Parkin and Fred Ransom-Smith.

results.title: Spinnolio
results.creator_credit: John Weldon, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Traditional folklore takes a wry turn in this animated tale about a carved wooden puppet who lacks mobility and human consciousness. Noted for his “cool head” and unruffled personality, the inanimate Spinnolio makes a totally passive, though quite successful go at life, until his employer decides to replace him with a computer. A modern-day fairy tale that smacks of the sardonic and has philosophical implications about the nature of consciousness, the work ethic, interpersonal relationships, and the citizen in society.

results.title: Spellbound (2002)
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Blitz, Sean Welch, Home Box Office and Thinkfilm
results.brief_description: This Academy Award nominated documentary focuses on eight children competing in a championship spelling bee. We see behind the scenes meeting the finalists and their families. The tension of the competition is gripping as is looking into the varying backgrounds of the contestants. The high pressure world of the spelling bee and the pressure placed on the contestants can cause a sweat in not only the contestant and their parents but also the viewer. Gruelling competition and high drama are found in this compelling documentary. Having the background knowledge on the competitors adds to the overall enjoyment. Notable is the fact that the winners in most cases are from ethnic backgrounds who are willing to work hard and succeed. There is certainly a great deal of face pulling and mental strain in this moving and exciting film.

results.title: Speaking of animals
results.creator_credit: Jerry Fairbanks and Jerry Fairbanks Productions
results.brief_description: A selection of short films and excerpts from the forties that apply visual effects to live action footage of animals so they appear to be talking and singing. While some segments are mildly amusing, the ones that feature monkeys performing humiliating tricks are less so. “Who’s who in animal land” and “And their families” won Academy Awards for Best Short Feature.

results.title: Speaking object-ly
results.creator_credit: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor, National Film Board of Canada and Yaletown Productions Inc.
results.brief_description: This film explores the concept that inanimate objects such as barber poles, candy wrappers, clothing and furniture can communicate complex and subtle messages about people and things. As images of familiar objects are presented, a rhythmic country-rock song raises questions about the messages they carry. The viewer is encouraged to think about how objects stimulate our associations in order to communicate an idea or manipulate our responses. Images by John Seale.

results.title: Speaking in Public (I'd Rather Be in Siberia)
results.creator_credit: Mike Barnacoat and University of Technology, Sydney. Dept. of Production Services
results.brief_description: The first part of this program, presented by Mike Minehan, provides you with an overview of the skills you will need to become a successful presenter - preparation, posture, gesture, facial expression, eye contact, language, vocal skills and energy level. The second part of the program shows a highly skilled public speaker, Father Peter McGrath, giving a lecture to nursing students.

results.title: Spartacus (Bolshoi Ballet) [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: A Bolshoi Ballet performance in two acts of Spartacus by Aram Khachaturyan with choreography by Yuri Grigorovich and featuring dancers Vladimir Vassilyef, Natalya Bessmertnaya, Maris Lieppa, Nina Timofeeva and The Bolshoi Theatre Orchestra and Choir.

results.title: Sparrow
results.creator_credit: Polly Watkins, Trish Carney, Australian Film Commission and In Posse
results.brief_description: A young family lives isolated in rural Australia with the father, a truckie, almost always away. Sparrow asks her mother what the difference is between ghosts and spirits as she ponders the death of the family dog. The mother remains emotionally distant until Sparrow’s curiosity with death leads her to dig up a family secret. ‘Sparrow’ explores the quiet of the emotions within a family and creates a portrait of emotional distance affirmed with the slow pace of country life and the very distant horizon. Cast includes: Molly McCaffrey and Leverne McDonnell.

results.title: The Watchkeepers
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Antelope Films, Channel Four and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
Satellite technology combined with computer graphics can present an enormous range of information about Spaceship Earth and its inhabitants. This information can be climatic, demographic, geographic, religious, horticultural, agricultural and social. This program reviews the range of information accessible via these combined technologies and with the help of the NASA computer examines the first “living portrait” of the earth.
